I'm a John S. Knight Fellow at Stanford University, where I'm researching on data analysis and visualization of major news events. Based on computational linguistics, I'm prototyping novel approaches for understanding and communicating complex topics.

For the last six years, I've been pursuing an interdisciplinary path involving data and civic startups, academic research, and health biotech. I was a member of the team launching the mapping platform CartoDB, and co-founder of non-profit organization porCausa.

I'm a lecturer on digital journalism at several universities in America and Europe, including the Knight Center for Journalism in the Americas at the University of Texas in Austin, IE Business School (Madrid), and Universidad de La Sabana (Colombia). I'm also a member of the social epidemiology research group at Universidad de Alcalá (Madrid).

Between 1998-2008, I was editor-in-chief at Spanish newspaper El Mundo. I was part of the team launching elmundo.es, I led the expansion of the 24/7 world affairs online coverage, and managed the definition and daily programming of the health channel —the largest health news website in Spanish-language.

I've lived and worked in Spain, US, and Japan.
